title: What are some of the best songs that feature spoken word lyrics? - Quora

response.answer_text: The Streets' Mike Skinner is somewhere between Rap and Spoken Word and most of his songs are like that  Nada Surf's Popular  Donovan - Atlantis  I don't care what everyone says, Selfie is a great track!  William Shatner has two spoken words albums. Here's one of the tracks, a rendition of Pulp's "Common People"  That one is a little funny because it's so melodramatic. The Shangri-La's "Past, Present and Future"  Arlo Guthrie's 18 minute long "Alice's Restaurant" was later made into a feature film

Ammunition Hill (גבעת התחמושת). This song, written in 1968, deals with the battle of Ammunition Hill in the Six Day War. Contrasting playful instrumentation with horrific verses and spoken word, this song is a great example of how to put in spoken-word segments in a song, and tells a powerful story.
I’m surprised that no one has thought of these two popular songs. Songs that had been sung with attitude. Lou Reed - Walk on the Wild Side Dire Straits - Sultans of Swing

Bill Cosby, “Little Ole Man.” (It’s an old Quora question. Just pretend I answered it in 2014.)  Linda Laurie, “Ambrose, Part 5.”  “Trouble,” from The Music Man by Meredith Willson  which brings us to the genre of talking blues, of which there are many
I’ve always loved Anne Clark. She has some stunning songs.  I absolutely love the combination of dance and poetry in this song.  Here is some newer work, which is also beautiful:
Set Fire to Flames shared some members with Godspeed You! Black Emperor and you can definitely hear the similarities in music and their use of sound bites from random people.
Have just found another fantastic example, a real beauty!: La Dispute - Objects in Space

Here’s a couple favorites of mine… Gil Scott Heron - The Revolution Will Not Be Televised  And this oddity from 1985.The title refers to the average age of the soldiers who fought in Vietnam. 19 - Paul Hardcastle
This begins with a spoken meditation, turns into a beautiful slow blues. Roy Buchanan - The Messiah Will Come Again:
Here’s a spoken word/musical poetry playlist on this blog post about musical poetry. Check it out: Musical Poetry
